page.title: 07GOREFIELD CHURCH
page.content: The church of{St.Paul}at{Gorefield, which was built in 1870,is a stone building in the{"Early English"}style. It consists of a chancel,nave,vestry, south porch and a west turret containing one bell.The first rector was Andrew Beck M.A. who stayed for 31 years.There have been 10 further rectors,and the current one is Jack Tofts.The organ in the church is original,and like the building,is 115 years old.Mr.Calver,who grew up in Gorefield has been attending the church since he was very young.In his early days,he was an organ blower, which he did twice a week for a penny.Mr.Calver said that he remembered when the church lighting was all the way down the aisle.One of the oldest books in the church is an Altar service book which was printed in 1928.
